pr_title: Added support for azure-core ClientOptions in Key Vault client builders.

timeline.message: Added support for `ClientOptions` in Key Vault client builders.

timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: Don't need this check.  forEach() will be executed only if there are elements in the list. Update this in other builders too.
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: This reads a bit odd - Sets the various options to be set...
timeline.author: srnagar

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/sdk/keyvault/azure-security-keyvault-administration/src/main/java/com/azure/security/keyvault/administration/KeyVaultBackupClientBuilder.java b/sdk/keyvault/azure-security-keyvault-administration/src/main/java/com/azure/security/keyvault/administration/KeyVaultBackupClientBuilder.java
index f7a12a4cbc1..cf225780295 100644
--- a/sdk/keyvault/azure-security-keyvault-administration/src/main/java/com/azure/security/keyvault/administration/KeyVaultBackupClientBuilder.java
+++ b/sdk/keyvault/azure-security-keyvault-administration/src/main/java/com/azure/security/keyvault/administration/KeyVaultBackupClientBuilder.java

@@ -292,7 +289,7 @@ public final class KeyVaultBackupClientBuilder {
     }
 
     /**
-     * Sets the various {@link ClientOptions options} to be set on this client.
+     * Sets various {@link ClientOptions options} on this client.
      *
      * @param clientOptions the {@link ClientOptions} to be set on this client.
      * @return The updated KeyVaultBackupClientBuilder object.

timeline.message: Corrected Javadoc based on PR suggestions.

timeline.bodyText:
Since user might not know what ClientOptions is for , we can explain in java doc more about what user can set with this.
Here is one example of java doc https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/pull/13697/files#diff-063fb5ef000495423cf8b8e2e66f8518R262
timeline.author: hemanttanwar

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/sdk/keyvault/azure-security-keyvault-administration/src/main/java/com/azure/security/keyvault/administration/KeyVaultAccessControlClientBuilder.java b/sdk/keyvault/azure-security-keyvault-administration/src/main/java/com/azure/security/keyvault/administration/KeyVaultAccessControlClientBuilder.java index e3a776f6bd3..630cb6e30d4 100644 --- a/sdk/keyvault/azure-security-keyvault-administration/src/main/java/com/azure/security/keyvault/administration/KeyVaultAccessControlClientBuilder.java +++ b/sdk/keyvault/azure-security-keyvault-administration/src/main/java/com/azure/security/keyvault/administration/KeyVaultAccessControlClientBuilder.java @@ -289,9 +289,13 @@ public final class KeyVaultAccessControlClientBuilder { } /** - * Sets various {@link ClientOptions options} on this client. + * Sets the {@link ClientOptions} which enables various options to be set on the client. For example setting an + * {@code applicationId} using {@link ClientOptions#setApplicationId(String)} to configure + * the {@link UserAgentPolicy} for telemetry/monitoring purposes. * - * @param clientOptions the {@link ClientOptions} to be set on this client. + *

More About Azure Core: Telemetry policy + * + * @param clientOptions the {@link ClientOptions} to be set on the client. * @return The updated KeyVaultAccessControlClientBuilder object. */ public KeyVaultAccessControlClientBuilder clientOptions(ClientOptions clientOptions) {

timeline.bodyText: same java doc comment like above.

timeline.bodyText: Could we add one test where use set a Header and it gets added to HttpRequest ?
timeline.author: hemanttanwar

replies.bodyText: I think we should be able to, let me see what I can do with the given time.
replies.author: vcolin7

replies.bodyText: Will add these tests in a future iteration. Discussed it with @hemanttanwar in a side conversation.
